website_summaries.verdict: A great buy for a serious power lifter.
pros: Cage construction can hold up to 800 pounds

website_summaries.verdict: Basic model allows for creative workouts without bolting the frame to your walls.
pros: A sturdy steel frame features 19 unique adjustments that enable multiple workouts while you feel both stable and strong
Points for a higher weight capacity of 800 lb
cons: May need careful configuration for heavy weights

website_summaries.verdict: This strong power rack supports accessories that can turn any home into a power gym.
pros: Sturdy frame for its compact and lightweight size
Strong enough to support as much as 800 pounds and still fit nicely in a home gym
cons: No clear way to secure frame to the ground
May need slight adjustments to keep from wobbling

customer_reviews.title: A little sketchy but for the price it gets the ...
customer_reviews.text: A little sketchy but for the price it gets the job done. I am still waiting for parts that are missing from the box which makes the item unsafe to use but I did not want to send it back. The main brace is missing. Hopefully it doesn’t fall over and hurt someone or myself. Manufacturer keeps saying they’ll send the missing parts but it’s been weeks. I’m at the point where I am going to have to do a chargeback to my Visa.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Rohr

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy - great price
customer_reviews.text: FYI: Look up the Ironman 810XLT rack- it is the exact same model with more reviews. Overall, I am very satisfied with this power rack. It was extremely easy to put together. All the bolts are the same... I would highly suggest getting a 17mm ratcheting wrench if you don't already own one in order to put this cage together. The rack is heavy and solid, and it doesn't move really at all. Shout out to u/Gym-gineer for this solid recommendation! What we could use now are some quality attachments in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Never got the cage or a refund for the cage
customer_reviews.text: The bench it self is very sturdy and extremely easy to put togeather. I canno't speak on behalf of the cage, because the cage itself never made it to me and I have not gotten a refund for the fact that the cage never made it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Rueda

customer_reviews.title: Missing cage
customer_reviews.text: I spent 335 on the cage and all that showed up at my door was the bench alone! I know I didn’t spend 335 dollars on a bench and cage is in the description. No where does it say only bench.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Missing Lat pull-down and leg hold
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 810 XLT Super Max Power Cage with Optional LAT Pull-Down Attachment. The cage arrived today, but not lat pull-down and leg hold. No one answers the phone at the manufacturers and their online chat bot had me wait and then told me no one was there and to leave a message. Where? Nowhere to leave a message. I called again and was told to leave my email address. Really? Not a telephone number? I'm not feeling it but if they come through and correct this ASAP I will change my review and rating.
customer_reviews.author: David Ball

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this it is junk and is falling aprt
customer_reviews.text: There is too much drag on the main bar when doing Lat Pds and this could cause injury. I wish I didn't waste my money on this garbage take a look at the pictures
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wills

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, NOT SAFE for strong people
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, affordable. But..... I lift pretty heavy weights and do not feel safe in this cage. Even with the stability bars it wobbles like crazy, not a safe feeling when trying to rack a 500lb squat pr. Also the safety bars come out easily! I also do some of ROM workouts and can see the safety bars slowly coming out in between every set. Makes it difficult to finish a workout when you have to pause in between sets to adjust the “catch”. If the price was 50% its be worth the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts- Absent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived damaged and missing all of the assembly hardware and short safety bars. This obviously isn’t the company’s fault, but after a week and half of calling and submitting tickets, I’ve gotten no response from the company. I ended up spending $50 to buy the 40 bolts, nuts, and washers required to build this thing. It’s a nice setup for the price, but missing the short racks makes squatting or benching pretty much impossible. I’ll more than likely be seeking a refund from the credit card company if I don’t hear from them soon.
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value power cage & fits my needs!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this about 2-3 times a week for over a year and I am still impressed! Value for your money for sure. I lift fairly heavy in this cage. 315-345 bench press and 335-365 squats. Not to mention, I also do pull-ups/chin-ups on this power rack also. To put that in more perspective, I weight 295 lbs. I think the cage is a bit more stable as I have a few plate holders with plates at the base. Overall, the cage is rock steady. Accessories I purchased: - Plate holders (from Titan) - Dip bars (specific for this cage & made by Fitness Reality) - J-cups (from some brand I can’t remember)
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Lee

customer_reviews.title: ONLY RECEIVED HALF OF THE ORDER
customer_reviews.text: Only received half of the order. Received only the lat pull down when the order clearly states power cage WITH OPTIONAL LAT PULL DOWN. Called an emailed several times with no response.
customer_reviews.author: Kirklyn simonton

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Company with No Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Fitness Reality is a terrible company with no customer service. I was shipped a defective item and now have $300 of useless metal sitting in my garage. I have wasted 2 weeks trying to get a replacement Upper Frame via phone and email with no results. I do not recommend making a purchase from this company.
customer_reviews.author: charles m meeks

customer_reviews.title: Missing Power Cage, Only received partial order
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the power cage and bench from Amazon but only the bench was shipped. I am missing the power cage. Tried to contact manufacturer directly (there is no other way to report missing items for this product) however, their customer service number does not work. Hopefully they respond and I am able to receive the power cage, then I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent First Home Gym Piece!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this about 3-4 days per week and paired with the 300lb universal barbell and weights from Dick’s Sporting Goods, I get a good workout. Since purchasing I’ve added the dips and leg lift straps attachments. I’ve also purchased a preacher bar and single metal handle to use with the cables. This is a very good cage. I would say there’s only a minor shake when I slam to barbell back after the last reps on bench. I also “upgraded” the bar holder pegs with rubber padded ones. Adding ankle straps for various leg workouts on the lower cable is pretty nice!
customer_reviews.author: TTBenz

customer_reviews.title: Frame cracks
customer_reviews.text: We have had our rack since March 2017 but over the last few months, we noticed these cracks start in the top four corners. The rack is easy to assemble but the cracks are concerning enough that we have stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: Traci D

customer_reviews.title: Average quality. Manufacturer absent on replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s a nice piece of equipment. Generally sturdy and worth the price point. Typical overseas manufacture. Two of the legs came a little scuffed up, but not a huge deal, it’s going to get used anyway. One of the little plastic feet came broken and I followed the instructions in the assembly manual and emailed the company with the pertinent info. They got back to me and asked for more info twice and then stopped replying. So expect to just have to live with broken parts and scuffed up paint for the price point. For more money get higher quality and well made. This fits its purpose for a home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Ordinary reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this. Great rack! Gave this picture so.you can tell if you can do overhead in the cage. I'm 5' 7" and with no shoes on my bar almost hits.
customer_reviews.author: kmarie26

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I recently put a garage gym together and with money being a big factor settled on this squat rack. It was fairly easy to assemble and has held up to this point. There is one support bar that is in an awkward spot and doesn't allow you to use the highest rack level or you risk hitting your head when getting the bar on or off the rack. DO NOT BUY the add ons for this rack. The weight holders and j hooks that are supposedly made for this rack are horrible and I sent them back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Takes the 810XLT cage to a new level
customer_reviews.text: Lat pulley attachment - Perfect fit onto the 810XLT cage, very smooth operation. Assembly is rather tedious and really helps to have someone else holding pieces with you. If you have 2” plates then you will want to get the peg adapters as they are 1”. The adapters are available on amazon but are an additional purchase. The handles are ok but you will want better ones as you get going. Look at Yes4All brand accessory handles.
customer_reviews.author: fastmatt

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this rack for about a month now and am generally happy with it. The base is pretty stable, not wobbly. I placed in on top of a homemade DL platform and it tends to slide on the plywood. There is no way to bolt this down without modifying the rack. The barbell holders suck, so I'll be upgrading them to j-cups soon. It's no rogue rack, so you'll have to lower your expectations, but for the price, it does what it's supposed to. The finish is pretty good, it's a bolt application so no crappy welds to deal with. Would buy again. The safety bars are sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Damian

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived defective
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived broken. I am currently waiting on a replacement or a way to return to sender.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Kyle Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is overall a good piece for the money. It’s sturdy but does wiggle a little. Hard to explain, it doesn’t feel like it’s loose it will Come apart but it does wiggle. Also the pulley attachment is not that smooth. I feel that the weight I put in has much more resistance that what I was used to at the gym. Overall I recommend for the money. If budget is tight and you want a home rack with pulley this is a good option. You can do a lot with this. If you can spend more, I recommend Rogue, titan, or rep. I would also recommend a 3x3 over a 2x2, there seem to be more attachments available.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Todaro

customer_reviews.title: Good rack, bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: The rack is sturdy and as large as you would expect (appropriate size). It doesn't sway or feel unstable when I rack the weights after benching (225lb), do pullups, or anything else. The packaging, however, was really bad. The rack is all solid metal (by which I mean hollow but strong) and pretty heavy, but it came in a thin cardboard box, which arrived ripped apart and wrapped with tape. The package which had the tools and bolts was ripped and 2 screws are missing (fell out during shipping from the box getting ripped). This is a good rack and I recommend it, but the manufacturer really should package it better.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Missing part of the order.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the power cage combo with the bench included and I received my delivery today. only the bench was delivered to me and the order is missing the cage. Im really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with defective parts - unusable
customer_reviews.text: The pull up bar on the squat rack did not fit and will need to be replaced. It’s an obvious manufacturing defect. I have not heard back from the product support team within the window that they quoted. They have a phone number but it doesn’t work. You have to submit a request via their website. I will update my review when I hear back otherwise I will be returning it. The bench was easy to put together and works pretty well. The foot holder part isn’t as study as I’d like but it gets the job done. Also it folds upright into storage in my garage pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Allen

customer_reviews.title: Defective parts, hell to return.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased so many products from this company and all of them have defective parts. Since the cage is too heavy to lift or wrap, it is killing us to return. Dealing with UPS is another pain in the ass. Extremely unpleasant experience. Will NEVER buy anything from them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble by one person.  All holes line up perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions were easy to follow and the power rack went together easily. The instructions say to leave all bolts loose until it's fully assembled, give it a shake, and then tighten all bolts. There is a descent amount of sway in all directions even when the bolts are tightened snugly, so you have to decide which way the unit leans when you tighten all bolts. So, I decided to get a level and make sure the verticals were truly level. The floor is not true level, but I reasoned that the vertical supports should take the weight straight down toward the floor, instead of them leaning a little.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It is a bargain, considering the price includes shipping! It's not a commercial gym item, but it isn't $1000+, either. It's great for its intended use: daily basics. I augmented with some "Yes4All" J-hooks to protect the Olympic bar.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected. A durable budget rack and bench.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived earlier than expected. Condition of shipment was good. No damaged parts. Assembly instructions were simple but very adequate. Assembled mostly by myself and could have completed without help. Lots of bolts for the rack, but all were the same size. Although needed tools were provided, recommend using a ratchet/socket wrench. The bench was a breeze to assemble and is sturdy and wide enough for my back. I thought the top support bar would be an issue, however it is not straight but offset and extends back allowing clearance for my head when unracking and racking the squat. I'm 6-1". Will update if any issues with use and long term use but initial impression is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: D. Curry

customer_reviews.title: Great power rack for college football player squatting +400 pounds or there Dad.
customer_reviews.text: When COVID-19 closed the college weight-room I bought this for my boys and me. Sturdy with +400 pounds for the boys. We had to re-drill a couple holes because some guy in China messed up the holes but pretty easy of you have a drill and the right bits. I will not resign with planet fitness - getting stronger working out at home! here is a great way to add a lat pull down station for $50 including the bar
customer_reviews.author: “Those who stay will be champions”

customer_reviews.title: Missing Bar and Bad Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Overall, great add-on. But this is twice that Fitness Reality Brand sent me a product with a missing component. I build the Last Pulley until I noticed at the end, I'm missing the Leg Holder. Contacted Seller via email. They were going to give me a response back in today's. A week almost past and no response.
customer_reviews.author: C. NaBaRo

customer_reviews.title: Solid cage for the price
customer_reviews.text: Built my garage gym with this as the main focus and am happy with the purchase. It was fairly easy to put together by myself and is strong enough to hold the weight that I use. I also bought the attachable hi/low pulley system that really helps the stability. I would recommend both. Be sure to follow the directions and only tighten when directed and you shouldn't have any problems with assembly. My only complaint is that the rear horizontal support bar is a little low and I have knocked my forehead more than a couple times. Might need to add some foam around it to stop the bruises.
customer_reviews.author: M_Woodland

customer_reviews.title: Very good, could use 2 small improvements.
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a 5-star review with two exceptions. First, the unit should come with 2” sleeve adapters to hold standard Olympic style weight plates. It comes with a 1” slider, so the sleeve adapters would allow either style of weight plate to be used safely. Second, I think the two small chains and the carribeeners are a little flimsy. When I compare them to other home units I have used (Marcy Pro, for instance), the chain links and carribeeners are thinner, lighter and less substantial. Other than that, I am very happy with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Chorbz

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service - Damaged cable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the power cage with the Lat Pulldown, i really like cage and even the lat pulldown, but for some reason, the cable for the lat pulldown was peeled off on day 1, i contacted customer service and they got back to me in couple days requesting photos and serial number, i responded with requested information immediately, it's been more than 2 weeks without a response from them. I sent more emails but still with no luck. This is unacceptable, i will initiate a return if i dont hear back from the vendor this week.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Quality and very stable.
customer_reviews.text: I use my rogue equipment and expensive attachments to it. Equivalent to industrial grade. Shakes a little when I do weighted dips or muscle ups. Simple 310lb dead’s and squats and reracks doesn’t need to be bolted down. This is an old picture I still have it. I revamped my garage gym with more rogue equipment this cafe is still awesome. Fake negative reviews be quiet. I have owned this for years now and have used it for some clients. Really great quality. I will update the picture later. I hold a diploma in exercise physiology and hold certification for nasm and health exercise psychology.
customer_reviews.author: NinaT

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've had this put together and have been using it for around 3 weeks now. It was a bit labor intensive to put together but not difficult. HINT: take the time to buy a racheting box wrench....speeds up the process. A few holes didn't line up completely but overall it took around 2 hours to set up. I *am* using it with my TRX, although I've got about 75 lbs of weights holding it down. I did that mostly because it isn't settled in it's final spot yet. It still feels super stable. For the price (paid about $270 with tax), it is a GREAT value. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Aquino

customer_reviews.title: Could’ve been a 5 star purchase
customer_reviews.text: I would’ve given 5 star if it was not for their horrible customer service. For the value, I think it has one of the best, if not the best value rack out there. I got it for $287 after tax, and it does the job just fine. It is not sturdy like the x-light big brother one and it does move a little when you rack it forcefully. However, it is not gonna collapse on you. I gave it one star because it was missing one screw along with washers and nut. Then when I contacted customer service, they gave me the screw but NO washers or nut. And when I contacted them again, they just ignored me.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: WELL MADE RACK
customer_reviews.text: This rack was easy to assemble. I’ve been using it every week since the purchase. I find it to be a true gym quality squat rack with versatility to perform many different types of lifts. The pull up/chin up bar is very sturdy. I am 185 lbs & it seemed very solid as I did sets. Overall solid product with a very competitive price. Believe me, I hunted for weeks for this purchase comparing every type of rack out there. Cheers. Have a good workout!
customer_reviews.author: ges

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: The cable broke in 3 months, I reached out to customer service with no reply.
customer_reviews.author: IBRAHIM

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but keep expectations in check
customer_reviews.text: If you only have $250 for a rack, this is your best option. It's solid enough for home use. It's lightweight 14g steel, so don't expect it to be solid as a rock. The 3" hole spacing isn't ideal but you can make it work by adding some wood under your bench. Shipping took longer than expected , I got mine in 8 days. If you can afford a better rack, get one. If not, this will save you well for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great Value / Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: First, you get a “10” for shipping! The shipping box was double-reinforced, with thin pieces of wood inside the box, to keep it from collapsing during delivery. Each piece was wrapped in plastic and all the corners were wrapped and taped in cardboard. Not one piece was damaged, scratched or bent, so assembling went without a hitch! Sturdy piece of equipment and nice design, since I use mine as a jungle gym, adding ropes and straps, for hanging, stretching and body weight exercises. Great value for the price. My research showed this as being a top choice as a power rack and I see why! NOTE: Purchase the optional dip bars! Great add-on!
customer_reviews.author: Fred C.

customer_reviews.title: It would get 5-stars for being a good rack, it gets 10 stars for ease of assembly
customer_reviews.text: It does everything that a rack should do, and the best part is that it can be assembled with two 5/8" sockets. Each piece consists of either good welds or sturdy bolts with nice lock-nuts. If you are lacking space like I am, this rack is what you need. I have a space that's about 7' by 8' maximum and this fits perfectly, I can do any exercise I'm looking for. As you can see from the image I mounted the chin-up bar upside-down as I saw mentioned in another review because the room is only 8' tall and I feel like I would be close to hitting my head if I'm doing full chin-ups with it the other way.
customer_reviews.author: N. Neff

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery, No damage, Works and looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loves it! Happy Husband happy life! :) lol Really though it was a great purchase especially since it was super hard to find one for a decently reasonable price. It’s strong, sturdy for the weight we want. Not going over 300lbs. We love that you can adjust things if need to be. The black and grey tone matches our theme so it’s all good! Got here wayyyy faster than expected so thank you for that as well. :) Came from Texas and with no damage. Packed great! Cardboard box yeaaa but I mean what do you really expect when shopping online.?! So thank y’all! P.s we also purchased suggested bench which we also LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. G

customer_reviews.title: High quality at an unbelievable low price
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months of almost daily use I’m very happy with this system. The setup was easy (decent directions) and the parts were laid out nicely; made it easy to follow along on assembly. I mounted it on an 8x8 wooden platform making this thing incredibly sturdy. Amazon put it on sale a day after I received it and would not price protect so they can suck it. But the system is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rack and a great value. Sturdy build, steady when setup. Between myself and my two high school football players that also competitively power lift, it gave them all the options they needed to get lifting done at home during quarantine when the gyms are closed. This is a quality product, easy to assemble. Bolts are really dirty but hands wash when done. Assemble but don't tighten bolts until you have it in place, then settle it in where you're putting it and tighten up. You'll be pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: PowerFish

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts - unable to use
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing ! Cage arrived but all the Lat pull-down , Leg hold down and pulley systems are missing! It states in description: "Includes high and low row pulley systems. High tensile strength nylon coated cable. Easy glide 2” x 2” chrome guide rail for smooth operation. Includes one 39” bar and one 20” low row bar attachments with foam grips" Unable to use this as I was mainly needing it for the pulley system and less for the weights etc Have requested a return though this will be extra effort
customer_reviews.author: Antonjolly

customer_reviews.title: make sure you receive all your items unhappy with mine 🤬
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Power cage WITH lat pull down attachment and only received the latpulldown attachment complete rip off I returned it instead 😒
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid and Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: This is a rock solid structure after assembly. The assembly instructions are well written, the nuts and bolts are individually packaged for each step of the assembly which eliminates the need to identify the pieces. Even though two people would be needed for some of the steps, I was able to assemble this single-handed. Two of us have been using it for pull ups and weights and have detected no swaying or movement. I would have liked for more than just the two cross bars for pull-ups because the bars in the existing configuration are too close for a good shoulder workout when doing pull-ups.
customer_reviews.author: TexasRanger

customer_reviews.title: Sent wrong part and won't send replacement
customer_reviews.text: One of the parts does not have any holes drilled in it, so I cannot assemble this product unless I drill through the steel multiple time myself in the precisely correct locations. Reached out to the manufacturer for a replacement, but never got a response. Will be challenging this charge. Terrible product, no support. DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Schneier

customer_reviews.title: Just a great rack and almost fun to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This company did something so smart- wrap the bolts needed for each step in a separate small well labeled and convenient package. They included the 2 needed wrenches but I recommend A socket to save time. Very solidly constructed and powder coated. Safe design so I can Do bench press along and come just short of full range of motion which stresses the shoulder anyway, and if I fail I can Safely leave it there and slide out. Same for squatting. Very safe and well designed. I’d buy again for sure. 10 stars for price, design and clever packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but a little weak
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love having a squat cage! The assembly took quite a while, much longer then expected, but it was not difficult. Most of the instructions were clear, and the packaged bolts and nuts were numbered according to the steps. My only dislike is how much the cage moves. I was sure to tighten all bolts and nuts appropriately, but it still racks from side to side a little more then my comfort level likes. I also wish it had a couple of areas to bolt to the floor, but those are easily created.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: does not support standard plate weights
customer_reviews.text: One major flaw in an otherwise very clever design. The attachment fits the rack perfectly. The issue is the bar that you load weight onto is not standard size. So if you're like me and bought the rack and ordered a standard 45lb barbell with plate weights your weights are useless on this machine. It uses the tiny bar. Typically weights you can buy with a tiny hole in them are often not heavy at all max 10 lbs. good luck getting anywhere near an actual workout with the tiny weights this thing supports.
customer_reviews.author: A Suace

customer_reviews.title: Very good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good product for the price. Assembly was easy for both. They came with good instructions and the squat rack had prepackaged bolts organized into the assembly steps. For our purposes, the rack is strong and sturdy enough but we're a 160 and 115lb couple that only has a 210lb weight set currently. It wobbles very slightly when we do pull ups so if you weigh significantly more than 160lbs, it may be risky. The bench, on the other hand, is very sturdy and love the different angle options. Overall, we're very happy with this purchase and have already put it to use multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Whyte

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love it for a home gym. Its sturdy enough for me to do my pull ups, pulldown and squats. I will be adding other attachments but so far, I'm enjoying it. My 10 year old helped me assemble and it didn't take much time at all.
customer_reviews.author: monika robinson

customer_reviews.title: Careful on Replacement Parts
customer_reviews.text: Looks like I will be sending some equipment back soon. This company uses Paradigm Health and Wellness for replacement parts, which has been closed and unresponsive for over a month. Their website says open but clearly not from other reviews. Received rack with a top beam piece welded incorrectly for assembly. Rack completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I only received half the assembly
customer_reviews.text: I received the cage, but DID NOT receive the optional LAT pulldown assembly. My order clearly states WITH. It should have been included but it was not.
customer_reviews.author: renee m. rennie

customer_reviews.title: Honestly not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Sabe your time and money. For the $700 dollars we spent on this. I honestly expected more. Don’t waste your money. Go to their competitors and get a better product for less. Im not writing this out of bitterness. But it’s the truth. We waited 2-3 months for this. Paid a lot and one of the pillars arrived indented.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price and 800lb. max weight capacity
customer_reviews.text: The product is of excellent and fit quality and I feel the investment was perfect. Makes me "all I can be". The service reps are another issue that left me little to be desired. I pointed out a simple error in the installment instructions that led me to install the foot incorrectly which therefore caused the foot to crack. Of course I knew Fitness Reality would replace the footing however I got no replies from my calls or emails. Amazon took care of the rest, end of story.
customer_reviews.author: PINKY

customer_reviews.title: Great product! I was fortunate to get this near ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I was fortunate to get this near $155 (including shipping) and is probably still a good value at the current price $300. Anyway it came properly packaged and protected to my front porch. Assembly was straight forward and took around 1.5 hours. Seems sturdy for me but I don't push alotta plates around. My only criticism is the barbell holder pins are low quality and a little loose. To be expected at this price point...
customer_reviews.author: Steve Reno the Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, built well, very useful
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty easy to put together other than really could have used 1 extra person to build it. Only thing I didn’t like was building it then having to partially take it apart to add the cable system. I had installed the cable incorrectly which made the plastic covering split. I contacted the company and they’re sending me a replacement for free! They got back to me in like 4 days. Amazing customer service. The pulley system is great except the weight holder is kind of small like it was built for 1 inch instead of 2 inch plates if I had one true complaint. But still 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the money.
customer_reviews.text: After much time doing research I chose this cage. It arrived extremely well packaged. My husband had it installed in about 45 mins, with me helping only to hold up one side for bolting. It was easy, with everything being labeled. I wish all companies had the same ease of build. Fits nice in our garage that has a 96 inch roof. We put the pull up bar upside down only because I’m 5’4. However will be flipping it right side up for more uses with the pull ups. I’m not a beginner weight lifter, but certainly not an aspiring hulk either and this will do perfect for any workout I’m looking to do. Overall very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: H20NWVS

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately I didn't have any of the issues other seemed to. No cracks in the steel, safety and support bars lock in place with NO chance of falling out while lifting. Follow the instructions and don't tighten anything until you are done. Give it a really good shake and tighten everything down. I used a socket set and box wrench to secure the nuts better. Very solid piece of equipment. I am 235 pounds and can do pull ups all day long without issue. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A Steal
customer_reviews.text: For the price... I don't think there's anything better. The cage takes up very little room and it's sturdy enough for me to do pull ups on (I weigh about 220 pounds), and to clumsily rack my barbell after bench press or squats. It's easy to assemble which means you could be using it an hour after receiving it. The powder coating looks nice and seems to be holding up under my usage. I bought the combo (squat rack and bench) for a little over $300. I think it was a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Rasheed

customer_reviews.title: more than what I need
customer_reviews.text: anyone that says this isn't good is probably a power lifter that drops the weight more often than not. I don't work out nearly what I use to but this is good enough for the dad who is trying to stay fit and not get fat. FYI this goes really good with my New Balance dad edition shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a garage gym.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a beefy little home rack, look no further. It took us about an hour to put together using a rubber mallet and 17mm socket wrench. It doesn’t take up a ton of space, but you also don’t feel squeezed when you’re working in the rack. I’m a 5’10” 160lb athletic build woman, and this rack doesn’t budge when I use the pull up bar. Picked this up at a steal for around $250 after taxes... this thing will last forever. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I am not 100 % satisfied with the product which is not the way it looks on Amazon. I ordered Fitness Reality 810XLT Super Max Cage With lat pull-down attachment and adjustable leg hold down. Paid for $944.00 Look what I just got today! Fraudulent!!! So frustrating !!!
customer_reviews.author: Nay Six

customer_reviews.title: BENCH DANGEROUS - Bench Broke after 4 weeks - Squat Okay
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this with the bench. After 4 weeks of use one of the welds broke. I only had 135lb total including the bar when I was incline benching and one of the welds broke. This is a VERY DANGEROUS bench. I was very lucky that I did not get hurt. The squat rack is cheap but pretty stable. I would recommend not buying this and spend a little more money and get a cheap Titan rack or any other rack. DO NOT BUY/USE THE BENCH.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hornick

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to squat 500 pounds!
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price and easy to assemble. Will move side to side a bit when unracking and reracking. This is perfect for a first home gym power rack. I do plan on upgrading, but I am happy with it for now. I squat, and bench out of this rack multiple times per week. I've failed one squat around ~450 pounds on to the safeties and they seem okay. Also successfully squatted 500 pounds. I would recommend plate storage and proper J-cup accessories if you want to move some big boy weight.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Wait for the price to go back to 220-250
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good power cage and essential for home gym. But post-covid sellers are driving up the prices. Amazon should really keep an eye on sellers of gym equipment. I remember seeing this listed for 220$ pre-covid days. I even asked the merchant for a price match but no response...
customer_reviews.author: SudheerKalva

customer_reviews.title: Excellent power rack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Just put this baby together tonight. Love everything about it. Sturdy, solid, clean and well made. Nothing about this product disappointed me. Yes you could spend more money and get more features, but this has everything I need to get back into my bodybuilding routine. The product arrived on time, and very well packaged. You can tell unpacking it that every part is heavy duty. This is not cheap junk. Maybe just one step below professional/gym grade equipment. Excellent assembly instructions: thorough, yet concise. Not much else to say except that I can’t wait to get back in shape. Very, very pleased. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Barr

customer_reviews.title: Well built, well packaged, reasonable assembly time
customer_reviews.text: In a day and age where product manufacturers provide very weak instruction and provide poor packaging, this was a refreshing purchase. The instructions are very clear and well illustrated. The individual parts were very well packed, individually wrapped and taped up. So well in fact that it was slightly annoying to have to unwrap every single part, but it’s great for ensuring little to no damage during shipping. The cage is very sturdy and seems to be versatile. I expect to get plenty of use out of this equipment for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR TRX
customer_reviews.text: I've seen people say this was difficult to assemble... it's not. Theres only 11 pieces plus the nuts & bolts. The schematic is confusing to read, but if you allow logic to prevail it's simple. I bought this to do TRX in the garage, but at 180 its unstable and I pull it over. I'm thinking I need to anchor it to the ground (with chains or something) so I don't feel like I just wasted $250... Despite what some have said in their comments this is not suitable for TRX movements. It unfortunately falls short of my intended purpose, and that's why it loses a star.
customer_reviews.author: javlin4u

customer_reviews.title: Awesome find!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack. I got lucky and was able to purchase this before other sellers marked it up. Took me a couple of hours to assemble by myself, but nothing I couldnt handle. Rack is very sturdy, probably wouldn't fit if your a powerlifter squatting 1000 pounds, but it fits my needs perfect. I am able to to do plenty of exercises on this: floor barbell bench, barbell squats, bent over rows, pull ups. I highly recommend this for a budget garage gym.
customer_reviews.author: joeyD

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Hey there I am writing a review on this power cage. For what it is this power cage can get it done!!!. Since the closing of all gyms in my city. Due to the covid-19 virus, I had to set up a gym of my own without breaking my bank account and losing all the progress that was achieved prior the pandemic. Buying this power cage was a no brainer affordable and I can accomplish what needs to be done for my weight training needs. Provided its not made from superior materials like the racks at the new streamline gyms. This cage works for me. I am very happy with the product.........
customer_reviews.author: L. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I hadn’t waited
customer_reviews.text: It’s the perfect size for our bedroom gym with standard ceiling heights and handles our modest 250lb weightlifting with ease. TRX requires additional weight to be added and hasn’t been a problem. I tend to throw the bar back into the holders at the end of the set. I’ve added some padding between the base and the walls floor molding. The upper support bar does get in the way when re-racking the weight from squats. It may be just be my fat head at 6ft.
customer_reviews.author: TRx

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DEAL
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for my teenage son so he can do squats and lifts without a spotter. We have it in our garage. He loves it. It is very sturdy and says it is real similar to the ones they have at school. It is a great deal because I saw so many others that were so much more expensive and I cannot imagine them being as nice as this one. Sturdy and a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Genia Cole

customer_reviews.title: If customer service is important...
customer_reviews.text: The cage is fine, but customer service is terrible. I got the lat pull down attachment and the company has different serial numbers for this part. The instructions were written to adjust build based on serial number, apparently no one read over it because the instructions don’t line up as instructed. No one picks up the phone and emailing gets an auto reply that is unhelpful. Figured it out by site, but who knows if I got the right parts. These cages are all about the same price so if customer service is important, then I recommend choosing another company.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great Price Based Performance
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy and solid rack and has held up well in the month or two since I’ve first purchased. I am looking into potentially purchasing new jhooks as the ones that come with the rack are fine, but are a bit questionable on sturdiness over time. The rack isn’t as sturdy as other racks, but is understandable as it costs much less than other racks. Overall good product if you’re not putting up crazy numbers in which case I would recommend a more sturdy option for safety reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought the power cage for this several months ago, and have been using it quite a bit, and recently got this add-on separately. The instructions are mostly straight forward, but it can be hard to get everything aligned properly so all the holes line up. I would recommend using a ratchet with a socket, and a rubber mallet (to tap things into place) to speed up assembly for anyone looking to put this together. With that said, it seems very sturdy, and definitely gives me some extra flexibility for workouts, and I do believe that even without bolting anything down to the floor, the original cage is much more sturdy with this addition.
customer_reviews.author: Khlaid

customer_reviews.title: Cool, So I looked at a ton of options ...
customer_reviews.text: Cool, So I looked at a ton of options before pulling the trigger on this one. I wanted strength, Affordability, quality. Better than a straight bar pull up bar. Strength, ive done pullups im 200lbs with 200lbs of weight on it with no issue. Price and shipping is affordable. Other than not having Jhooks. But ill be buying some Jhooks here soon and a landmine. The pullup bar I taped up as Its clear I would slip off if I was sweaty some 5$ athletic tape was my solution (in Hot pink because hell yea) Overall this is as much as I was hoping for and am very excited to have it!
customer_reviews.author: Pete Haglund

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Great Cage!!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money!! It was easy to assemble, it did take a couple of hours to put together but I wasn't rushing to put it together. All the parts were there and nothing was damaged when delivered. Been using it for 6+ months and it's used 5 times a week and it's held up great and I haven't had one issue. It's sturdy and stable when performing squats, etc. I would recommend this rack to anyone, for the price and quality of the rack, you honestly cannot find a better deal out there!
customer_reviews.author: dmg987987

customer_reviews.title: Lat PullDown attachment review
customer_reviews.text: I gave a review of the power rack that was amazing, so I bought the lat pulldown. The quality is the same as the rack...solid and exactly what I need. The instructions on this sucked though and putting it together was not fun. I finally got it all together and I'm very happy with it. READ CAREFULLY you need 2" adapter sleeves for olympic plates to fit. That was the only thing I misread and was surprised to see. They are clear about it, I just misread it. They make quality stuff and the price is right. This attachment has made my home gym complete and I don't need the gym for anything now.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not trying to do anything crazy with this, but it remains sturdy and capable of racking 315 with ease. Couldn’t be happier, easy to assemble and sturdy once it is assembled. I bought both the cages and pull down/row system. The only complaint I have about the attachment is that you don’t get very much lubricant to overcome the friction of the weight caddy. Normally I’d just buy more, but crazy times...also, it’s 3/4 inch bars, so not really made for the Olympic plates, but doesn’t seem to be an issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend this product. Defective and missing item.
customer_reviews.text: Rear cross bar item is missing. Took them 1.5 months to reply my email. After two emails, their respond are back at square one. Bad customer service. Also the row pulley are defective, that plastic ball is not safely attached to the lock, then a small circle meta piece came in between those small wheel caused my cable damage. My photo’s shown the missing part from this product. Bad bad bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ling T.

customer_reviews.title: Good rack for the price but it damages easily.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned my rack for about 2-3 months. Installation was simple to instal but really time consuming if you don’t have power tools. Note to self—- INVEST IN POWER TOOLS. Any way, this rack has been really good so far however, it tends to warp and scratch easily!! Especially the main frame. This is a cheap rack so you can’t expect much but I did hope for the damage to show at least a few more months in, rather than 2-3.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: NO POWER CAGE
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS JUST THE LAT PULL DOWN ATTACHMENT!!IT DOES NOT COME WITH POWER CAGE
customer_reviews.author: Eric misa

customer_reviews.title: Great product however....
customer_reviews.text: After unboxing, I noticed a part that goes to the LAT attachment add-on damaged. See pictures. I will call customer service to see about a replacement part. I will come back to edit this review after getting the replacement. EDIT - I did not have to contact customer service about the piece pictured. Overall quality of this equipment is great. Changing my rating to 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking, this is the one
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to assemble, it took me about 1hr 40min to complete. I had my girl assist me and she was surprised at how quick we finished. Everything fits perfectly into place (tip: tighten all the screws at the very end) Once I completely tightened everything the rack had a small wobble, it wasn't that noticable but I know it's there. Sturdy and great for pull ups at different angles. The lock in bars are not my favorite, will probably buy some different ones because they don't feel secure. I heard no other ones for but I'll still try it Overall would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Chunky

customer_reviews.title: Great pulldown
customer_reviews.text: if you have the 810xlt power cage this lift is such a great addition. I wish I didnt have to pay 300+ for it because its not being made anymore, but it was worth it even at that price because it works well and fits perfectly. I was using a homemade thing, but honestly it was a huge pain and not very versatile and I was spending more and more money on making it better, but would never be this good.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Must for a home gym
customer_reviews.text: Solid piece of equipment. No pun intended. Very impressed. Super easy to assemble. Fits perfect into the garage. Comparable to some racks I've used at membership gyms. One caveat: i suggest throwing some concrete 50# bags on the bottom middle and back end. Or you can bolt it down. I almost had it topple over on me as I was doing a TRX exercise. Other than that, excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Brooksie

customer_reviews.title: Great for bodyweight work
customer_reviews.text: This was a step up for me, as I was using a two-post rack before and it wobbled quite a lot on some exercises. This rack was easy to assemble and is rock-solid for bodyweight training using rings and dip bars. A word of advice if you do buy this rack: assemble it so that all the nuts are facing outwards. This will keep the potentially sharp threaded bolt ends out of your work area.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to install, but tool info is incorrect
customer_reviews.text: I built this for my neighbor. It was super easy to install. The instructions look like there are a lot of parts but there is not. And ALL the nuts and bolts are the same size! They provide 2 tools but use ratchets if you can. They say use 17mm and 13mm which is incorrect, 13mm is too small. I used 17mm and 11/16th sockets on two ratchets and it took less than an hour. Feels heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: dennis

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack but not deep enough
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice rack, very sturdy, but the back supports don't extend far enough back for any normal bench to go back far enough to do incline presses inside the cage. The lower support just gets in the way and you're too far forward to rack and unrack the bar. Especially if you get the additional lat pull-down attachment with the lower cable position.
customer_reviews.author: sliderhouserules

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: ***update*** this squat cage has become the center of my home GYM. it has helped with Bench, Calf raisers, overloads pull ups, dips etc anything that you can thing off you can get it done on this. i could not be anymore happier with this cage and i am glad i made the decision to spend the amount that i did vs. a $600+ cage. you should do it too. great product and def worth the buy as compared to others that are worth double of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M.

customer_reviews.title: Great rack
customer_reviews.text: Very good rack. Wished it had holes on the bottom and top and not just the upright rails. But it does exactly what I wanted it to do and does it well. Racking weight doesn’t appear to create any noticeable wobble, pull-ups and dips (separate attachment) rack is solidly planted. It’s only limitations is the holes not being in the entire system but plenty of adjustment holes as is for now.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Humphries

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I really like this rack as a relative beginner. Be sure to follow the directions and wait til it’s all together and tighten the bolts.wish the safeties weren’t chrome but are ok. Size is good, any smaller and it would be hard to use-any larger and I would have space issues. I love the pull up bars. I’m 6’1” so I have to lift legs off the floor once I grab the bar. I got the matching dip bars and they work great. Braces have an extra hole in the middle, I’m thinking it may be for a lat pull down attachment that isn’t available yet. Very good especially considering what it costs.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great value, no issues to report
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to work out during the quarantine. I thought it was easy to assemble. Took me an hour to assemble. Delivered before the estimated delivery date. Looks to be well made. Great value for the price. I really like the pull up bar part. Comes with all the basic things needed to use. Like bar rest and safety bars. Can be used with a bench and as a squat rack. No negatives to report.
customer_reviews.author: MrWounderful

customer_reviews.title: Great Cage
customer_reviews.text: Great cage for the price. Just finished assembling it. Its really sturdy. I noticed some reviews say it’s too top heavy, I tried tipping it in purpose and I couldn’t. I can easily do pull ups without fear of it falling. I saw some people asking about bar lengths as well, my 6’ and 7’ fit no issue, pictures included in review. The box was in great condition when I got it, and some parts did have cosmetic damage and scratches. However it doesn’t look like it affected the quality. So there is some QA for aesthetics that are overlooked. Will update once I’ve used this for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Artemys

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy SOB
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy SOB; need 1 other person though and a good set of tools. If you lack either it's gonna be a day job assembling it for sure. I know because I've bought this power rack one other time and assembled it mostly by myself with a crap set of tools. Took me 2 days by myself. Granted I wasn't very tool savvy but now I am. Regardless this rack is amazing and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Nason

customer_reviews.title: Not like the gyms rack, but perfect for home
customer_reviews.text: Like most people that are holed up due to Covid, we have turned our garage into a gym and this is a key component to that process. We are very happy with this purchase. My three sons and I have used the garage daily to stay in shape. This is a good product. Solid. It is not the caliber of the racks at the gym, but for the price I cannot and will not complain.
customer_reviews.author: S_T_N

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: Surprising quality at this price point. The packaging was good and the assembly instructions were clear. Everything fit well together so I didn't have to bang on parts for proper alignment which made assembly a breeze (end caps are tapped into place, but they are DESIGNED for a snug, interference fit). Since no one will ever confuse me with aqua man, the weight rating on this rack far exceeds any requirement I'll ever have. I absolutely see no reason whatsoever to spend more on a rack unless you're INSANELY strong or have a JUMBO bundle of coin to drop on a rack. Since neither of those conditions apply to me, this unit fits my requirements PERFECTLY.
customer_reviews.author: B. Leinz

product_meta.title: Fitness Reality 810XLT Super Max Power Cage with Optional Lat Pull-down Attachment and Adjustable Leg Hold-down
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One Fitness Reality Super Max Power Cage with two chrome dual mounted safety bars and two chrome lock-on safety. Olympic bar, weight plates and bench are not included

Cage dimensions – 50.5” L x 46.5” W x 83.5” H | Set up weight – 133.5 lbs. | Carton dimensions – 79” L x 13” W x 10” H | Carton weight – 148 lbs. | Weight capacity – 800 lbs. | Bar dimensions – 2” x 2”
Ideal for squats, shrugs, chin ups/pull ups, incline/decline bench presses and other strength training exercises
Each pair of bars can handle a weight capacity of 800 lbs and are adjustable to 19 height levels to give you a total range of work out positions
At the back of the Power cage, two rear stability bars are added to provide solid-state performance while performing strength-training exercises

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
